intro: Alsinopsis quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved alsinopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
